item.title: Arash add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "Always do sober what you said you'd do drunk. That will teach you to keep your mouth shut." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Arash add a quote by Robert Louis Stevenson
item.description: "You think those dogs will not be in heaven! I tell you they will be there long before any of us." -- Robert Louis Stevenson

item.title: Arash add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Arash add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Arash add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Arash add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Arash add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Man is the only creature who refuses to be what he is." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Arash add a quote by Malcolm X
item.description: "My alma mater was books, a good library.... I could spend the rest of my life reading, just satisfying my curiosity." -- Malcolm X

item.title: Arash add a quote by Malcolm X
item.description: "You're not to be so blind with patriotism that you can't face reality. Wrong is wrong, no matter who does it or says it." -- Malcolm X

item.title: Arash add a quote by Gordon A. Eadie
item.description: "If you don't stand for something you will fall for anything." -- Gordon A. Eadie

item.title: Arash add a quote by Michael Pritchard
item.description: "You don't stop laughing because you grow old. You grow old because you stop laughing." -- Michael Pritchard

item.title: Arash add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "Whatever you are, be a good one." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Arash add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "Nearly all men can stand adversity, but if you want to test a man's character, give him power." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Arash add a quote by Jostein Gaarder
item.description: "Superstitious." What a strange word. If you believed in Christianity or Islam, it was called "faith". But if you believed in astrology or Friday the thirteenth it was superstition! Who had the right to call other people's belief superstition?" -- Jostein Gaarder

item.title: Arash add a quote by Jostein Gaarder
item.description: "It's not a silly question if you can't answer it." -- Jostein Gaarder

item.title: Arash add a quote by Paulo Coelho
item.description: "When I had nothing to lose, I had everything. When I stopped being who I am, I found myself." -- Paulo Coelho

item.title: Arash add a quote by Thomas Fuller
item.description: "It is said that the darkest hour of the night comes just before the dawn." -- Thomas Fuller

item.title: Arash add a quote by Paulo Coelho
item.description: "People are capable, at any time in their lives, of doing what they dream of." -- Paulo Coelho

item.title: Arash add a quote by Paulo Coelho
item.description: "One is loved because one is loved. No reason is needed for loving." -- Paulo Coelho

item.title: Arash add a quote by Paulo Coelho
item.description: "And, when you want something, all the universe conspires in helping you to achieve it." -- Paulo Coelho

item.title: Arash add a quote by Mary Higgins Clark
item.description: "It's funny how, even long after you've accepted the grief of losing someone you love and truly have gotten on with your life, every once in a while something comes up that plays "gotcha," and for a moment or tow the car tissue seperates and the wound is raw again." -- Mary Higgins Clark

item.title: Arash add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "Try to understand men. If you understand each other you will be kind to each other. Knowing a man well never leads to hate and almost always leads to love." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Arash add a quote by Hermann Hesse
item.description: "If you hate a person, you hate something in him that is part of yourself. What isn't part of ourselves doesn't disturb us." -- Hermann Hesse

item.title: Arash add a quote by Jean Paul Sartre
item.description: "Better to die on one's feet than to live on one's knees." -- Jean Paul Sartre

item.title: Arash add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "All war is a symptom of man's failure as a thinking animal." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Arash add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description:
"Beer is proof that God loves us and wants us to be happy.
[misquote of a letter about wine, see quotes/831031]" -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: Arash add a quote by لودويگ ويتگنشتاين
item.description: "وقتي به يك چيني گوش مي دهيم،تمايل داريم حرف زدن او را غرغره كردني ناواضح بناميم.كسي كه چيني بلد است در حرف زدن او،زبان را باز خواهد شناخت.اين سان است كه اغلب نمي توانم انسان بودن را در يك انسان باز شناسم." -- لودويگ ويتگنشتاين

item.title: Arash add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "You know you're in love when you can't fall asleep because reality is finally better than your dreams." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Arash add a quote by Richard P. Feynman
item.description: "Nobody ever figures out what life is all about, and it doesn't matter. Explore the world. Nearly everything is really interesting if you go into it deeply enough." -- Richard P. Feynman

item.title: Arash add a quote by عباس معروفی
item.description: "هميشه ميخواستم بدانم مرز احساس و منطق كجا تعيين ميشود.در آلمان فهميدم كه مرز احساس و منطق در فرهنگ تعيين ميشود.در درازاي تاريخ.آلماني ها كانت دارند و ما حافظ." -- عباس معروفی
